arts.ttl: Wout Faes fires late winner as Leicester sink Sheffield Wednesday amid protests
arts.athr: Billy Munday at the King Power Stadium
arts.sum: Martí Cifuentes has cleared his first hurdle as Leicester manager. The former QPR coach took the time to do a lap of the King Power Stadium while his players warmed up, introducing himself to the home supporters. A late header from his substitute Wout Faes ensured that those fans went home happy – but for much of a testing opening game against Henrik Pedersen’s Sheffield Wednesday, who have had to face plenty of obstacles before a ball was even kicked this season, that looked an unlikely outcome. For Wednesday, it was an achievement to even be here. Placed under a transfer embargo by the Football League because of late payments, they have only 15 senior first-teamers on the books and cancelled their final pre-season fixture, against Burnley, after the players refused to play. They and the staff were paid their outstanding July wages on Friday after solidarity payments from the Premier League came in. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Leicester v Sheffield Wednesday: Championship – live
arts.sum: Minute-by-minute updates on the EFL Championship game Email Daniel | Championship roundup: Bristol City stun Blades Some thoughts on the regulator from someone who should know: It’s worth remembering that the threat of a points deduction still hangs over Leicester. Continue reading...
